heading: # Bottom sheets
headingText: The bottom sheet is a modified `v-dialog` that slides from the bottom of the screen, similar to a `v-bottom-navigation`. Whereas a bottom navigation component is for buttons and specific application level actions, a bottom sheet can contain anything.
usageText: Here we display an example list of actions that could be present in an application.

inset.heading: ### Inset
inset.desc: Bottom sheets can be inset, reducing their maximum width on desktop to 70%. This can be further reduced manually using the `width` prop.

persistent.heading: ### Persistent
persistent.desc: Persistent bottom sheets can't be closed by clicking outside them.

model.heading: ### `v-model` control
model.desc: Bottom sheets can be controlled using `v-model`. You can use it to close them or if you can't use `activator` slot.

open-in-list.heading: ### Open In List
open-in-list.desc: By combining a functional list into a bottom sheet, you can create a simple 'open in' component.

player.heading: ### Music Player
player.desc: Using a inset bottom sheet, you can make practical components such as this simple music player.

props.inset: Reduces the sheet content maximum width to 70%.
